page.title: 04CRUWYS MORCHARD POPULATION
page.content: The most recent census was in 1981. We now have 170 adults including 30 over age 65 and 53 children. The largest group is the professionals, including lecturers, teachers, solicitors and farmers. Financially these are advantaged with good holidays and choice of private health care and education. Skilled people such as mechanics, electricians and farm workers have a comfortable style of living with cars, entertainments and annual holidays. The smallest group consists of labourers and unemployed. Unskilled, they have little financial security and rely heavily on social benefits. In general people live to about 80, due perhaps to a healthy environment, good housing and adequate medical care. The few young deaths are caused by accidents.
